data.name: SettingsImportOldExplanation
data.value: Settings from a previous version of the launcher have been found. You can import these existing settings to keep your installed Thrive versions and other customizations intact. If you do not import the old Thrive versions and caches, they will be left behind and this launcher won't know about them. Importing the settings is recommended.

data.name: ImportFailedMessage
data.value: Failed to import settings. Please make sure the relevant file paths for settings are readable and writeable by the launcher, then restart the launcher to try again.

data.name: ImportSucceededMessage
data.value: Previous settings have been successfully imported.

data.name: LaunchOptionDisableVideos
data.value: Disable all game videos (if Thrive crashes after showing the loading logo and before the intro video plays, this may help get the game to work)

data.name: LaunchOptionForceGLES2
data.value: Force GLES2 rendering mode (may make Thrive start, but causes slight graphics problems)

data.name: LauncherOptionHide32Bit
data.value: Hide 32-bit versions if an equivalent 64-bit version exists

data.name: LauncherOptionCloseAfterPlaying
data.value: Close Launcher After Playing (if no error)

data.name: LauncherOptionCloseAfterStart
data.value: Close Launcher After Starting the Game

data.name: LauncherOptionAllowSeamlessMode
data.value: Allow Seamless Launcher Mode (launcher doesn't show itself before starting Thrive)

data.name: TemporaryFolderNoFilesMoveNotice
data.value: Note: moving temporary location won't move or delete existing files to prevent accidentally touching files unrelated to Thrive

data.name: ClearTemporaryLocation
data.value: Delete ALL files in the temporary folder. May delete even non-Thrive related files if those exist!

data.name: ClearDehydratedLocation
data.value: Delete all files in the DevBuild dehydrated cache folder. If the location is non-default there may exist non-Thrive files in the folder which will also be deleted.

data.name: BuildTypeSelectionLatest
data.value: Latest (changes a lot randomly as this is literally a build from the latest code commit)

data.name: DevCenterConnectionExplanation
data.value: Here you can link the launcher to the ThriveDevCenter to access DevBuilds and other features

data.name: ManualHashSelectButtonToolTip
data.value: Select the manually entered hash value to be used from the input box as the selected DevBuild to play when playing a DevBuild

data.name: SettingsSaveFailedMessage
data.value: Saving settings to the settings file has failed. Please make sure the launcher has write access and try again. Launcher logs will have more info.

data.name: ThriveInstallFolderNotFound
data.value: The Thrive version installation folder does not exist.

data.name: RobotoLicenseTitle
data.value: Roboto font is used in the launcher, Roboto license:

data.name: LatoLicenseTitle
data.value: Lato.ttf (Copyright (c) 2010-2011 by tyPoland Lukasz Dziedzic with Reserved Font Name "Lato"), OFL license:

data.name: AllSigningKeysExpired
data.value: All of the signing verifying certificates that this launcher is shipped with have expired. This means that this version of the launcher is extremely outdated. Please download and install a newer version.

data.name: VersionInfoLoadFailureExplanation
data.value: Thrive Launcher loads the available Thrive versions from the internet in order to know what is available. Loading this information has failed (see the error below). You can retry downloading this information, or if the launcher was previously able to download this information you can load a cached copy. If the cached copy is very old it may not show all available Thrive versions. Note that if your version of the launcher is very old, it may no longer be compatible with a newer data format and must be updated before the data can be loaded.

data.name: VersionInfoLoadFailureBadData
data.value: The downloaded Thrive Launcher information is invalid. Please try again in a short while and if the issue persist please contact us.

data.name: NoCompatibleVersionsFound
data.value: The launcher could not find any compatible Thrive versions for the current platform. If you are using a weird operating system, this is expected. Otherwise, please report this as an issue.

data.name: MoveVersionsExplanation
data.value: Installed Thrive versions have been detected at the previous path. These can be automatically moved to the new location. If not moved the files will be left behind and the launcher won't know about them until the previous path is selected as the install location again. Would you like to automatically move these files to the new location?

data.name: MoveDehydratedCacheExplanation
data.value: Existing items in the cache have been detected. These can be automatically moved to the new location. If not moved the files will be left behind and the launcher won't know about them until the previous path is selected as the location again. Would you like to automatically move {0} file(s) to the new location? Note that if non-Thrive related files exist in the cache folder they will be moved as well.

data.name: InternalErrorExplanation
data.value: An internal error has occurred in the launcher. Please report this issue and provide the launcher log files along with your report how you ran into this problem.

data.name: DeleteErrorExplanation
data.value: Failed to delete data at the following path: "{0}" due to: {1}

data.name: DeleteErrorDoesNotExist
data.value: Failed to delete because the target path doesn't exist

data.name: ClearTemporaryFilesPromptExplanation
data.value: You are about to delete all the files contained in the temporary folder at "{0}". Even non-Thrive files will be deleted if any happen to exist in that folder. The folder itself will also be deleted. Delete the temporary folder?

data.name: ClearTemporaryFilesCount
data.value: You are about to delete {0} files / folders

data.name: ClearDehydratedFilesPromptExplanation
data.value: You are about to delete all the files contained in the dehydrated cache folder at "{0}". Even non-Thrive files will be deleted if any happen to exist in that folder. Delete the folder contents?

data.name: ClearDehydratedFilesCount
data.value: You are about to delete {0} files

data.name: ErrorSuggestionForMissingDll
data.value: The exit code can mean that you are missing a required DLL file. It may be Visual C++ Redistributable 2019, which you can download an installer for from: https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe in order to install / repair it. You can also try running Thrive.exe manually as that may show an error dialog with the missing DLL file name in it. You should check that you have all Windows updates installed. If these don't help please contact us for additional assistance.

data.name: ErrorSuggestionForStartupFailure
data.value: If the game did not start correctly, please try the Thrive launch workarounds available under "Thrive Options" in the launcher settings

data.name: LauncherIsLatestVersion
data.value: This version is up to date

data.name: OutdatedLauncherVersionComparison
data.value: You are using Thrive Launcher version {0} but the latest version is {1}

data.name: OutdatedLauncherExplanation
data.value: This version of the launcher is outdated and should be updated. As you are seeing this message auto-update has not started so you will need to manually download the update and install it. You can try to use the current version of the launcher by skipping updating, but you may run into unexpected issues as only the latest launcher version is guaranteed to work with the remote systems the launcher interacts with.

data.name: OutdatedLauncherTypeCannotUpdate
data.value: You are using a type of the launcher that cannot auto-update. If you would like to use auto-updates in the future, please install a variant of the launcher that has auto-update capability.

data.name: OutdatedLauncherUpdateHasBeenAvailable
data.value: The launcher type you are using should be able to auto-update, but it has not worked for some reason and the latest launcher version has been available for a while now. Please check that you haven't disabled keeping Thrive up to date.

data.name: OutdatedLauncherUpdateDisabledByUser
data.value: The launcher type you are using is capable of auto-updating, however auto-updating is currently disabled either by the launcher settings or a commandline flag.

data.name: OutdatedLauncherTypeHasNoUpdateFile
data.value: Error: no update file found for this type of launcher. This should not happen. Please try again later and if the issue persist, please let us know.

data.name: DevCenterConnectFailureForbidden
data.value: Connecting to the DevCenter has failed. The DevCenter responded with a forbid response. This means that our connection key is no longer good. This may be caused by the connection being disconnected through the web UI or your account may be suspended. See the link below to check your account's connection statuses.

data.name: DevCenterConnectFailureConnection
data.value: Connecting to the DevCenter has failed. Please try again as the DevCenter may have just been temporarily unavailable. You should also check your internet connection. You can use the link below to visit the DevCenter to see if your browser can connect. Please try again later and if the problem persists for more than a few minutes, please report it.

data.name: DevCenterConnectFailureUnknown
data.value: Connecting to the DevCenter has failed. The DevCenter responded with an unknown error or we ran into an error handling the response. Please try again later and if the problem persists, please report it. You can check with the link below to see if everything looks fine on the DevCenter's side.

data.name: EnterDevCenterConnectionCode
data.value: Please enter a DevCenter connection code first in the input box

data.name: DevCenterConnectAttemptError
data.value: Error checking linking code for the DevCenter. Please verify you typed in the code correctly and that it has not expired. Extra information: {0}

data.name: ConfirmValidLink
data.value: Code is valid. Please confirm linking to the following account:

data.name: LinkFormingFailedError
data.value: Failed to form the link, please check the code again

data.name: LoginToSeeThisContent
data.value: Login to the DevCenter to see this content

data.name: ThriveCurrentlyRunning
data.value: Thrive has already been started, please close it and then try again

data.name: NoVersionSelected
data.value: Please select a Thrive version from the dropdown next to the play button and try again

data.name: GettingDevBuildInfoMessage
data.value: Retrieving info about selected DevBuild of type {0} to play...

data.name: ErrorGettingDevBuild
data.value: Error: failed to find DevBuild of specified type for current platform. Please select another build, for example the recommended BOTD, and try again. Cause of failure: {0}

data.name: PlayingUnsafeBuildWasCanceled
data.value: Playing an unsafe build was canceled

data.name: ThriveRunError
data.value: Thrive failed to run due to the following error: {0}

data.name: NoBuildToPlayFound
data.value: No DevBuild matching the required type and current platform found

data.name: ExtractError
data.value: Failed to extract an archive due to error: {0}

data.name: MissingThriveFolderError
data.value: Thrive folder should exist at {0} but doesn't

data.name: MissingThriveExecutableError
data.value: Unable to find Thrive executable in folder at {0}, please either verify the game files or delete the version to re-download it.

data.name: VersionInstallationOrCheckFailed
data.value: Version installation or checking installed version failed, see below for details.

data.name: ThriveFolderPrepareFailed
data.value: Preparing Thrive folder failed with error: {0}

data.name: ExtractingStateItemProgress
data.value: Extracting {0}. This may take many minutes for large files so please be patient.

data.name: ThriveLaunchFailurePreventedAutoClose
data.value: Error: child process has already ended, launcher window will not be closed

data.name: TruncatedGameOutputWarning
data.value: Output is too long, it was truncated! See the Thrive log file for full output.

data.name: ThriveIsStarting
data.value: Thrive is starting. Log output (due to buffering this is likely not in real time):

data.name: ExtraThriveStartFlags
data.value: Thrive is being started with extra flags passed as command line arguments to the launcher, these may make Thrive behave in an unexpected way: {0}

data.name: StoreVersionExternalVersionsNote
data.value: This tab lists externally installed versions. This is a store version of Thrive that includes a bundled (latest) game version. You can enable showing available external versions on the version selector dropdown in the launcher options. Once downloaded those versions show up here.

data.name: DevBuildTypeSelectionHeading
data.value: DevBuild type to play (when playing a DevBuild version is selected)

data.name: PlayUnsafeBuildExplanation
data.value:
Normal DevBuilds are uploaded automatically by a CI server with a verified key. These builds can only be triggered by Thrive repository members. Unless such a person's account is compromised (or they act maliciously) the builds are about as safe to play as official releases. DevBuilds are also accepted from pull requests (PR), but in this case they are specifically marked unsafe (such as the currently selected build) as the pull request could contain all kinds of nasty stuff.
If a Thrive team member verifies that the PR is safe this warning goes away. Alternative you can continue if you believe that this build is safe. Before doing so you should check the PR on Github to see that the latest commit hash matches and that the ThriveDevCenter build job says that it has uploaded a DevBuild with the hash. Additionally it should be checked that the PR does not change any build scripts. After doing that it should be relatively safe to continue, this is the same process Thrive team members use to verify PRs.

data.name: AcceptUnsafeBuildButton
data.value: I understand the risk, play anyway

data.name: FoundDevBuildToPlayInfo
data.value: Found DevBuild to play: {0}, hash: {1}, is BOTD: {2}, branch: {3}

data.name: RehydrationStarting
data.value: This is a dehydrated build. Beginning rehydration.

data.name: CopyLogWindowToClipboardToolTip
data.value: Copy the game output to clipboard

data.name: CancelCreatingReportExplanation
data.value: Are you sure you want to cancel creating a crash report? If no reports at all are submitted for a specific bug, the developers of Thrive may not know about it and are thus unable to fix it.

data.name: SubmittingReportMessage
data.value: Submitting your report. Please be patient as uploading may take up to a few minutes...

data.name: ErrorSubmittingReport
data.value: An error occurred when trying to submit your crash report. Please verify the data is correct or try again later if the problem is a server issue. Failure type:

data.name: SubmittingReportExtraInfo
data.value: Extra information regarding the encountered error:

data.name: SuccessfulReportSubmitMessage
data.value: Your report has been successfully submitted. Thank you for your report.

data.name: ReportViewingPublicInfo
data.value: You can view your report, if it is public, at the following address:

data.name: ReportDeleteInfo
data.value: If you want to delete your report, you can do so here:

data.name: ReportDeleteCaveat
data.value: IMPORTANT if you lose your delete link you won't be able to delete your report. So save it! You can press the copy button to the right of it to copy it.

data.name: ReporterEndMessage
data.value: You can now safely close this reporter. Or wait until this window automatically closes in

data.name: CrashReportLogsSectionExplanation
data.value: Please keep the logs included if they are from the same run of the game as the crash because the logs may help in identifying and fixing the problem. You can click the name of the file to open it, or the button to view the folder it is in, to view and edit it to remove any personal details you want. Log files are always only visible to Thrive developers, and are only shared with other parties if required for tracking down or fixing the reported problem.

data.name: CrashReportDescriptionField
data.value: Describe what you were doing when the crash happened (optional)

data.name: CrashReportEmailField
data.value: Your email, if you want to receive updates about this report (optional)

data.name: CrashReportEmailFieldNotice
data.value: Your email will only be visible to ThriveDevCenter administrators.

data.name: CrashReportIsPublic
data.value: Public? Public reports have their crash callstack and description publicly visible. Private reports are visible only to Thrive developers.

data.name: CrashReportSubmitAcceptConfirmation
data.value: I agree that the information listed on this form, including any included files and the crash dump, along with my IP address will be stored in the Thrive crash database. And if this report is public anyone can read the crash callstack and description.

data.name: SelectCrashToReport
data.value: Select a crash to report by clicking its name

data.name: CrashReportDeleteAfterSubmitting
data.value: Delete this crash dump file after reporting (recommended)

data.name: CrashReportWarningAboutOldFile
data.value: The selected crash happened a while ago. As such it may not be related to the latest log files or the game output stored by the launcher. Please check carefully if you are reporting the right crash and related log files.

data.name: CrashReportIncludeLauncherOutput
data.value: Include the game output as shown in the launcher currently played game popup (recommended when reporting a crash from the latest run of the game)

data.name: ReportSubmitErrorTooManyRequests
data.value: Submitting the report failed due to too many recent requests from your IP address, please wait up to an hour and then try again

data.name: ReportSubmitErrorServerError
data.value: Submitting the report failed due to a server problem, please wait some time and then try again. If the issue persists, please let us know.

data.name: ReportSubmitErrorBadRequest
data.value: Submitting the report failed due to bad information entered in the crash report form, please double check the information you are trying to submit and then try again

data.name: ReportSubmitErrorNetworkError
data.value: Submitting the report failed due to a network problem, please check your internet connection and try again in a few minutes

data.name: ReportSubmitErrorUnknown
data.value: Submitting the report failed due to an unknown error, please try again later

data.name: LauncherOptionShowExternalVersions
data.value: Show external Thrive versions that require separate downloads to play

data.name: StartedAutoUpdateExplanation
data.value: The launcher is currently downloading and installing an update, please wait. The downloaded updater may open a new window that requires user interaction to complete the update.

data.name: AutoUpdateMissingChannel
data.value: Cannot retry an update as this launcher type doesn't have an associated update channel type

data.name: AutoUpdateRetryFailed
data.value: Retrying the auto-update has failed. You can ignore the failure to clear out existing auto-update files to make the launcher try again the next time it is restarted.

data.name: AutoUpdateSucceededMessage
data.value: The auto-updater should have started. You should now, or in a few seconds, see a new window opening for the updater. The launcher needs to be closed for the update to finish. You can close the launcher manually or wait for automatic closing in

data.name: AutoUpdatingFailedExplanation
data.value:
Automatic updating of the launcher has failed. The problem is likely that the update installer failed to run correctly. You can retry running an updater by clicking its name below. Alternatively you can press the button below to open the folder the first updater is in, which should allow you to manually run the installer (please let us know if this helps in your case).
You can ignore the failure in order to delete the downloaded updater files and retry the update the next time the launcher is restarted.
If no files are listed below, downloading the update has failed and it cannot be retried without restarting the launcher.

data.name: ViewFirstAutoUpdaterFolder
data.value: Open Folder First Updater Is In

data.name: CannotSubmitExceptionReportYet
data.value: The crash reporter doesn't support reporting crashed caused by unhandled exceptions yet. Please use the copy button below to copy the report to your clipboard and then manually send the report to us.

data.name: ThriveRunRetryStarting
data.value: Thrive was not detected as having started correctly. Will attempt to start Thrive again, attempt number: {0}

data.name: LauncherOptionShowLatestBetaVersion
data.value: Show latest available beta version of Thrive in the version selector (if available)

data.name: LauncherOptionShowAllBetaVersions
data.value: Show all existing beta versions of Thrive

data.name: Embedded7ZipLicenseTitle
data.value: The launcher includes some tools bundled in. These are separate executables the launcher invokes as command line programs. 7-Zip license:

data.name: EmbeddedPckToolLicenseTitle
data.value: Bundled godotpcktool license and its used libraries licenses:

data.name: LauncherOptionAutoRestartThrive
data.value: Automatically restart Thrive if starting it fails
